title: Arrest made in fatal shooting of Colorado Springs teen
content:
The teenage boy found shot to death this week has been identified, and a boy has been arrested.
The male juvenile, whom police did not name, was arrested on suspicion of first-degree murder related to the death of 15-year-old Sir Croix Alexander Armstrong of Colorado Springs, police said Thursday.
Armstrong was a sophomore at Harrison High School, said Christine O’Brien, spokeswoman for Harrison School District 2.
Just after 3 p.m. Tuesday, police received a call about a boy who was shot inside of an apartment in the 400 block of South Murray Boulevard.
An autopsy found that Armstrong's cause of death was a gunshot wound. He is the city's 21st homicide this year. Last time this year, there had been 24 homicides in Colorado Springs.
